data.title: Congregational United Church of Christ in Newton, Iowa
data.meta_description: United Church of Christ in Newton, Iowa fatihfully serving our community with love and compassion since 1891 - Our faith is 2000 years old; our thinking is not.
data.text:
Worship

Please Note: In-person worship services are also broadcast live Sundays beginning at 11:00AM on facebook.com/NewtonUCC and posted immediately following the worship service on facebook.com

/NewtonUCC and on our website at www.uccnewton.org.

​

Any additional services (such as Christmas Eve, Ash Wednesday, and Maundy Thursday) will be announced in the weekly update, on our Facebook page, and here on our website.

​​ Upcoming Events​​​

​

Our in-person worship service begins Sundays at 11:00am, and is livestreamed on facebook.com/NewtonUCC

​​​​

​​​

​

NO MUSICAL MOMENTS & MEDITATION IN AUGUST. SEE YOU IN SEPTEMBER!

Newton CUCC hosts a joint membership breakfast beginning at 9:00am in the downstairs dining room. The Joint Worship Service begins at 10:30am or streamed live on facebook.com/NewtonUCC.

THIRTEENTH SUNDAY AFTER PENTECOST

August 18, 2024

ORDER OF WORSHIP

Joys & Concerns

Welcome & Announcements

Prelude "I Know Whom I Have Believed"

Gathering Hymn #602 "O Master, Let Me Walk with Thee"

Call to Worship

Invocation

Reading Proverbs 9:1-6

Gospel Acclimation Hymn #259 "Spirit of the Living God"

Gospel John 6:51-59

Sermon “With and for the Community of Believers”

Music for Reflection "Be Thou My Vision"

Prayer for Transformation

Words of Grace

Sharing of God’s Peace

Offertory "O Worship the King"

Doxology #47 "Praise God from Whom All Blessings Flow"

Prayers of the People

The Lord’s Prayer

Sending Hymn #552 "Standing on the Promises"

Benediction

Postlude "Just for Today"

Pastor – Kurt Hoover

Liturgist – Jenni Pryke

Organist – Bev Thomas

Today’s service order was adapted from: For Wisdom: Service Prayers for the Thirteenth Sunday after Pentecost Year B was written by the Rev. Dr. Cheryl A. Lindsay who serves as Minister for Worship and Theology for the United Church of Christ. With Prayers of the People adapted from ELCA Resource “Sundays & Seasons”

"I Know Whom I Have Believed" by Jan Alexander. © 2006 Soundforth, a division of The Lorenz Corporation.

"Be Thou My Vision" harm. By Carlton R, Young. © 1964 The United Methodist Publishing House.

"Just for Today" by Hugh S. Livingston, Jr. © 2014 Lorenz Publishing Co., a division of The Lorenz Corporation.

All other recorded music is within the public domain.

Permission to podcast/stream the music in this service obtained from ONE LICENSE, License #A-731412. All rights reserved.

All other recorded music is within the public domain.

You are invited to send your financial offerings to:

Congregational United Church of Christ

308 E Second St. N, Newton, IA 50208

​

Congregational UCC is excited to offer you the opportunity to give online through Tithe.ly! You can give by visiting

https://tithe.ly/give?c=1633938

Additionally, you may give by downloading the Tithe.ly app on your smartphone and simply searching for "Newton Congregational United Church of Christ." Donations may be made using a credit card or a bank account. Tithe.ly gives those donating the option to cover the fees associated with each online giving transaction if you choose (these fees are lower when giving through your bank account). Please contact the church office (641-792-3773) If you have any questions or difficulties giving through this new platform. And, thank you for your continued generosity during these challenging times!

​
